active-users: Same as 'users' but indicates the users are active in editing activity.
adblock-error-title: Title for error message shown when the user has an ad blocker enabled.
adblock-error-body1: Body for error message shown when the user has an ad blocker enabled.
adblock-error-body2: Additional text for error message shown when the user has an ad blocker enabled.
admins:
Word for the users who have sysop rights on a wiki.
{{Identical|Admin}}
agent:
Header for the part of the interface that lets the user choose which type of browser agents to view statistics for. For example, 'User', 'Spider', etc.
{{Identical|Agent}}
all:
Label for option to view statistics for all platforms.
{{Identical|All}}
all-languages:
A link to show the article in the multilingual pageviews tool. This appears in the 'info tiles' on Pageviews Analysis
{{Identical|All languages}}
all-of-wikimedia: A link to https://wikimedia.org , shown next to the number of pageviews for all Wikimedia projects.
all-projects:
Title of the chart when showing pageviews for all Wikimedia projects. Opposed to {{msg-wm|Pageviews-individual-projects}}
{{Identical|All projects}}
all-time:
Link to set the date range to the maximum allowed range.
{{Identical|All time}}
always-include-redirects: Label for option to always include redirects of the requested pages.
another-query: Link to run a new query on the Langviews application
api-error: Generic error message for when something went wrong while querying an API. $1 is the name of the API. This message is followed by the error returned by the API.
api-error-no-data: When the API returned no data
api-error-timeout: Error message saying the API timed out and the user should wait a few minutes before trying again.
api-error-unknown: Error message saying an unknown error occurred when querying an API. $1 is the name of the API.
api-incomplete-data: Error message saying that some data in the collection is not yet available for the given dates. $1 (***always treat as plural***) is the list of dates lacking data.
article-placeholder: Placeholder text for the form input where the user enters the names of the articles they want to view statistics for
articles:
The word for pages in the mainspace of encyclopedia projects.
{{Identical|Article}}
auto-pagepile-error: Error message shown when an automated PagePile failed to generate. $1 is the title 'PagePile' (not translatable) and $2 is the number of pages the tool will use instead of the PagePile.
autocompletion-redirects: Label for autocompletion with redirects search option.
autolog-option: Label for option to automatically use a logarithmic scale if it would better illustrate the data.
automated:
Label for option to view pageviews by automated programs only (not users or spiders)
{{Identical|Automated}}
average:
Header of the average pageviews per day column in the Langviews application.
{{Identical|Average}}
badges:
Header of the badges column in the Langviews application. Badges are special recognized articles, such as 'good articles' or 'featured articles'
{{Identical|Badge}}
basic-information:
Heading for the list of data showing basic information about a page or site.
{{Identical|Basic information}}
begin-at-zero: Label to show the chart with x-axis starting at zero. This message should be brief, and essentially identical to 'Begin at zero'.
begin-at-zero-option: Label for setting to always show the y-axis starting at zero
bezier-curve-option: Label for option to plot line charts using the Bézier curve
building-dataset: Message shown on the Massviews tool when data is being put together to be shown to the user. This is different than the 'fetching-data' message.
category:
Label for the 'Category' input field on the Massviews tool. This is also the label for the option to query for a category in the Mediaviews tool.
{{Identical|Category}}
category-subject-toggle: Option shown on Massviews when the 'Category URL' source is selected. This option tells the tool to use the subject page of any talk pages in the category.
change-chart: Link that allows the user to choose a different type of chart
chart:
Label for the button to show the 'chart view' of Massviews.
{{Identical|Chart}}
chart-preferences: Label for chart options in the settings interface.
chart-types: Header for the interface that lets the user choose what type of chart they want
class:
Classification of an article, also known as an assessment. This message should be brief.
{{Identical|Class}}
clear:
Label for the link to clear all pages from the page selector.
{{Identical|Clear}}
comma-character:
{{Optional}}
The character to show separating values of a list. In most languages this is a comma.
counts:
Label for the value showing the number of counts that a page received. This is an abbreviated word for 'pagecounts'.
{{Identical|Count}}
credits: Footer message crediting the programmers. $1, $2, and $3 are links to the programmers.
current-size:
Indicates the current size of a page.
{{Identical|Current size}}
custom-range:
Link to specify a custom date range
{{Identical|Custom range}}
daily:
Label for option to view statistics for on a daily basis in the Topviews app. Appears next to {{msg-wm|Pageviews-monthly}} and {{msg-wm|Pageviews-yearly}}.
{{Identical|Daily}}
daily-average: Label for the value showing the daily average of pageviews. This goes under a 'Pageviews' heading, so you do not need to use the word 'Pageviews'.
daily-pageviews: Label for chart options that show daily pageviews for each article
data-unavailable: Brief message indicating data is temporarily unavailable.
date:
Header for the part of the interface that lets the user select a date in the Topviews app. This may have the same translation as the 'dates' message, except singular.
{{Identical|Date}}
date-created:
Indicates the date a page was created.
{{Identical|Date created}}
date-notice: Notice informing the user that the tool does not have older data. $1 is the name of the tool.
date-type: Header for the part of the interface that lets the user select which date type they want to view statistics for.
dates:
Header for the part of the interface that lets the user select a range of dates
{{Identical|Date}}
day:
Used in the context of number of pageviews per day
{{Identical|Day}}
desktop:
Label for option to view statistics for desktop pageviews only
{{Identical|Desktop}}
devices:
shortened message for 'Unique devices', used as the heading for the column showing the number of unique devices for each project in the Siteviews app.
{{Identical|Device}}
documentation:
The word documentation. This is used as the text for a link to a documentation page.
{{Identical|Documentation}}
download-label:
Label next to the download buttons.
{{identical|Download}}
duration:
Label for the value showing the length of time of an audio or video file.
{{Identical|Duration}}
editors:
Label for the value showing the number of editors that contributed to the pages during the timeframe.
{{Identical|Editor}}
edits:
Label for the value showing the number of edits that occurred to the pages during the timeframe.
{{Identical|Edit}}
elapsed-time: Message saying the amount of time the operation took. $1 is the number of seconds.
error-please-report: Message that follows an error message, asking the user to first try reloading the page, or to report the issue. $1 is the URL of the link to report the bug.
error-timed-out: Error message saying that some opertaion (loading data, for example) took too long and was aborted.
exclude-redirects: Option to exclude redirects in the Userviews tool.
excluded-pages: Pages that are excluded from the Topviews list
external-link:
Label for the 'External link' input field on the Massviews tool. An external link is a link on a page that goes to other non-wiki websites.
{{Identical|External link}}
faq-agents-automated: FAQ - explanation of the 'Automated' agent option
faq-agents-spider: FAQ - explanation of the 'Spider' agent option
faq-agents-title: FAQ - title of the section explaining what the 'agent' options are
faq-agents-user: FAQ - explanation of the 'User' agent option
faq-anomaly-body1: FAQ - explanation of pageviews anomalies and how to identify false traffic.
faq-anomaly-body2: FAQ - explains how you can request an investigation on pageviews anomalies.
faq-anomaly-title: FAQ - title of the section explaining pageviews anomalies and how to identify them.
faq-bug-report-body: FAQ - body of the section explaining how to report a bug or request a feature
faq-bug-report-title: FAQ - title of the section explaining how to report a bug or request a feature
faq-chart-type-body: FAQ - body of the section explaining how to change the chart type. "Chart type" is the same as {{msg-wm|Pageviews-change-chart}}.
faq-chart-type-title: FAQ - title of the section explaining how to change the chart type. $1 is the message 'change-chart', which is the label of the button in the interface.
faq-counts-body: FAQ - body of the section exlaining how pageviews are counted. $1 is a link to a page on Meta, with the page name as the link text.
faq-counts-title: FAQ - title of the section explaining how pageviews are counted
faq-data-dumps: FAQ - title of the section about where to download the full pageviews datasets.
faq-data-dumps-body: FAQ - body of the section about where to download the full pageviews datasets.
faq-date-dot: FAQ - title of the section explaining what the dots next to the date labels are.
faq-date-dot-body: FAQ - body of the section explaining what the dots next to the date labels are.
faq-location-body: FAQ - body of the section about geographic data of readers. $1 is a link to stats.wikimedia.org
faq-location-title: FAQ - title of the section about geographic data of readers
faq-massviews-sources-category: FAQ - explanation of what the 'Category' source in the Massviews tool is. The message 'massviews-category-description' is shown before this message. $1 is a link to an example category.
faq-massviews-sources-external-link: FAQ - explanation of what the 'External link' source in the Massviews tool is. The message 'massviews-external-link-description' is shown before this message. $1 is a link to an example link search, and $2 is a link to the documentation on mediawiki.org, with the message 'documentation' as the link text.
faq-massviews-sources-hashtag: FAQ - explanation of what the 'Hashtag' source in the Massviews tool is. $1 is the untranslatable hashtag character '#', and $2 is an example hashtag.
faq-massviews-sources-pagepile: FAQ - explanation of what the 'Page Pile' source in the Massviews tool is. The message 'massviews-pagepile-description' is shown before this message. $1 is a link to to the PagePile tool with the non-translatable name 'PagePile' as the text.
faq-massviews-sources-quarry: FAQ - explanation of what the 'Quarry' source in the Massviews tool is. The message 'massviews-quarry-description' is shown before this message. $1 is the name of the Quarry tool and $2 is the name of the column that the Quarry dataset is required to have.
faq-massviews-sources-search: FAQ - explanation of what the 'Search' source in the Massviews tool is. The message 'massviews-search-description' is shown before this message. $1 is a link to an example search query.
faq-massviews-sources-subpages: FAQ - explanation of what the 'Subpages' source in the Massviews tool is. The message 'massviews-subpages-description' is shown before this message. $1 is a link to an example page.
faq-massviews-sources-template: FAQ - explanation of what the 'Template' source in the Massviews tool is. The message 'massviews-transclusions-description' is shown before this message. $1 is a link to an example template.
faq-massviews-sources-title: FAQ - title of the section explaining what the sources are in the Massviews tool.
faq-massviews-sources-wikilinks: FAQ - explanation of what the 'Wikilinks' source in the Massviews tool is. The message 'massviews-wikilinks-description' is shown before this message. $1 is a link to an example page.
faq-massviews-subject-page-body: FAQ - explanation of what the 'use subject page' option is
faq-massviews-subject-page-title: FAQ - title of the section explaining what the 'use subject page' option is. $1 is the i18n message 'category-subject-toggle'.
faq-multi-lang-title: FAQ - title of the section advertising the Langviews app
faq-old-data-body:
FAQ - body of the section about seeing old data.

"backfilled data to July 2015" can be translated simply as "since July 2015", if "backfilled" is difficult to translate into your language.
faq-old-data-title: FAQ - title of the section about seeing old data
faq-redirects-body: FAQ - body of the section about how redirects are counted. $1 is a link to the Redirect Views tool, with the message 'redirectviews' as the label. $2 is the message 'include-redirects'.
faq-redirects-title: FAQ - title of the section about how redirects are counted
faq-referrals-body: FAQ - body of the section about getting referral data. $1 is a link to discovery.wmflabs.org
faq-referrals-title: FAQ - title of the section about getting referral data
faq-return-to: Link to return to the main page for the tool. $1 is the translated tool name, as defined by the messages 'title', 'langviews-title' and 'topviews-title'.
faq-search-redirects-body: FAQ - body of the section about how to search for redirects. $1 is the label for the option to enable in the 'Settings' panel, and $2 is the message for the 'Settings' button. $3 is the link to the Redirect Views tool, with the message 'redirectviews' as the label.
faq-search-redirects-title: FAQ - title of the section about how to search for redirects
faq-source-pagecounts: FAQ - body of the section explaining what the 'pagecounts' metric is.
faq-source-pageviews: FAQ - body of the section explaining what the 'pageviews' metric is.
faq-source-title:
FAQ - title of the section explaining what the 'metric' options are.

* "Metric" is {{msg-wikimedia|Pageviews-metric}}
faq-source-unique-devices: FAQ - body of the section explaining what the 'unique devices' metric is.
faq-todays-date-body: FAQ - body of the section about data for today's date
faq-todays-date-title: FAQ - title of the section about data for today's date
faq-top-viewed-title: FAQ - title of the section advertising the Topviews app
faq-topviews-false-positive-body1: FAQ - body of the section explaining that there could be false positives in the Topviews report. The "English Wikipedia" should be translated as-is.
faq-topviews-false-positive-body2: FAQ - an additional body of text explaining that there could be false positives in the Topviews report.
faq-topviews-false-positive-body3: FAQ - an additional body of text explaining how the user can report false positives in the Topviews application. $1 is 'topviews' message, $2 is the 'report-false-positive' message, and $3 is the 'excluded-pages' message.
faq-topviews-false-positive-body4: FAQ - an additional body of text explaining how the user can identify false positives in the Topviews application. $1 is the 'show-mobile-percentages' message (label for the checkbox), $2 is the 'platform' message (label for the dropdown), and $3 is the 'all' message (value in the Platform dropdown).
faq-topviews-false-positive-title: FAQ - title of the section explaning that there could be false positives in the Topviews report.
faq-try-tool: FAQ - link to 'try' the other tools (Langviews, Topviews). $1 is the link to the tool.
fatal-error:
Wording saying an unrecoverable error occurred
{{Identical|Fatal error}}
featured-article: The name for the 'featured' quality assessment of a page. The name may differ project to project, see Wikidata for possible translations: https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q17437796
featured-list: The name for the 'featured' quality assessment of a list article. The name may differ project to project, see Wikidata for possible translations: https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q17506997
fetching-data: Text shown below the progress bar in some apps to indicate initial data is being fetched. $1 is the name of the API that is being used.
file:
Heading for column in Mediaviews tool that shows the name of a file.
{{Identical|File}}
file-type:
Label for field explaing the type of a file, such as 'audio' or 'video'.
{{Identical|Type}}
files:
Label for the option in the Mediaviews app to query for individual files.
{{Identical|File}}
format-numbers: Label for option to format numerical data according to the user's language, for example, '1,234' instead of '1234'
fr: Abbreviation for Friday, a day of the week.
good-article:
The name for the 'good' quality assessment of a page. The name may differ project to project, see Wikidata for possible translations: https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q17437798
{{Identical|Good}}
hashtag:
Label for the 'hashtag' input field on the Massviews tool. This is the same word you would use for tags like #example on social media sites such as Twitter and Instagram.
{{Identical|Hashtag}}
hashtag-credits: Message giving credit to the the Wikipedia Social Search tool that makes the hashtag functionality in the Massviews tool possible. $1 is a link to the tool with the non-translatable name of the tool.
help:
Label for the help button dropdown.
{{Identical|Help}}
help-translate: Link to translation page on translatewiki, to encourage the user to help translate
history:
A link to the wiki revision history page of the article. This appears in the 'info tiles' on Pageviews Analysis
{{Identical|History}}
hosted: Footer message about where the tool is hosted. $1 is a heart symbol (♥, meaning 'love'). $2 is the name of the hosting service, for example, 'Tool Labs'.
hover-to-exclude: Placeholder in the input of the Topviews application, instructing to hover over entries and click on the X to exclude them from view
include-redirects: Label for checkbox to include all redirects of the requested page.
include-subcategories: Option in the Massviews tool to include all subcategories when querying for a category.
individual-projects: Label for the option to view data on individual projects in Siteviews, as opposed to {{msg-wm|Pageviews-all-projects}}.
info:
A link to the wiki page information page of the article. This appears in the 'info tiles' on Pageviews Analysis
{{Identical|Info}}
invalid-category-url: Error message saying the user inputted wiki URL is not a valid category (as in the Category namespace).
invalid-lang-project: Error message saying the given value is not a valid WMF multilingual project. $1 is the name of the project.
invalid-media-file: Error message used in the Mediaviews app, shown when the user queries for an invalid audio or video file. $1 a link to the file.
invalid-page-url: Error message saying the user inputted wiki URL is not a valid page.
invalid-params: Generic part of error message. Should include punctuation at the end.
invalid-project:
Error message saying the given value is not a valid WMF project.

Parameters:
* $1 - the name of the project.
* 2 - a link to the list of supported projects, with {{msg-wm|invalid-project-link}} as the link text.
invalid-project-link: Text for link to list of supported projects. Used in the {{msg-wm|invalid-project}} message.
invalid-quarry-dataset: Error message saying the user inputted a Quarry dataset without the required column. $1 is the name of the column that is required.
json:
{{Optional}}
Link for JSON file. See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JSON for information on what a JSON file is.
known-false-positives-link:
This message is used as part of the 'known-false-positives-text' message. It may be identical to the 'num-pages' message. $1 is the number of pages that are excluded from the Topviews interface.
{{Identical|Page}}
known-false-positives-text: $1 is a link to show a modal listing the known false positives, with the message 'known-false-positives-link' as the text. $2 is the number of pages that will be listed.
language:
Header of the language column in the Langviews application
{{Identical|Language}}
langviews: Abbreviated name of the Langviews application. This is used in the inter-app links in the header
langviews-description: Brief description of the Langviews tool. Shown directly under the header.
langviews-title: The title of the Langviews tool. This is shown as a header at the top of the page.
last-month:
Link to set the date range to the last month
{{Identical|Last month}}
last-week:
Link to set the date range to the last week
{{Identical|Last week}}
last-year:
Link to set the date range to the last year
{{Identical|Last year}}
latest:
Label for the 'latest' dropdown next to the date selector.
{{Identical|Latest}}
latest-days: Label for the 'latest' dropdown next to the date selector, when a number of days has been specified. $1 is the number of days. The word 'days' should not be included, in order to keep the wording brief.
learn-more:
Link to bring the user to the FAQ.
{{Identical|Learn more}}
links:
Label for the column that has links to other applications for the page.
{{Identical|Link}}
list:
Label for the button to show the 'list view' of Massviews. 'Table' might also be a fitting translation.
{{Identical|List}}
list-false-positives-text: Message above the list of known false positives in Topviews. $1 is the message "learn more" with a link to the FAQ.
list-values: Used to show a list of values or parameters, and that only one of them can be selected. $1 is the comma-separated list, $2 is the number of items in the list. The PLURAL magic word does not necessarily have to be used.
loading-cache: Message shown on the Massviews tool whend data is being loaded from cache, as opposed to being loaded from the server. See the wikidata item for 'Cache (computing)' for a list of possible translations for the word 'cache': https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q165596
localization: Label for localization options in the settings interface.
localize-dates: Label for option to format dates according to the user's language, for example, '5/23/2015' instead of 2015-05-23
logarithmic-scale:
Label to show the chart using a logarithmic scale. Translation may easily be found on Wikidata, see https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q937378
{{Identical|Logarithmic scale}}
main:
Name of the main namespace for Wikimedia projects.
{{Identical|Main}}
mainspace-only-option: Label to show only mainspace pages in the Topviews app.
massviews: Abbreviated name of the Massviews application. This is used in the inter-app links in the header
massviews-category-description: Description of the 'category' source in the Massviews tool. This is shown below the input field, and also in the FAQ. $1 is a link to a page describing what a category is, with the message 'category' as the link text.
massviews-description: Brief description of the Massviews tool. Shown directly under the header.
massviews-empty-set: An error message saying that $1 (a category or page pile) contains no pages
massviews-external-link-description: Description of the 'external link' source in the Massviews tool. This is shown below the input field, and also in the FAQ. $1 is the URL to a page describing what external links are, with the message 'external-link' as the link text.
massviews-hashtag-description: Description of the 'hashtag' source in the Massviews tool. This is shown below the input field, and also in the FAQ. $1 is the message 'hashtag-credits' which links to the Wikipedia Social Search tool. $2 is a link to the documentation explaining what a hashtag is, with the message 'hashtag' as the link text.
massviews-notice: Notice telling the user to try the Massviews tool to query for more than $1 pages. $2 is a link to Massviews.
massviews-oversized-set: An error message saying $1 (a category or page pile) contains too many pages to process. $2 is the formatted total number of requested pages, $4 is the total number of requested pages to be used with PLURAL, $3 is the number of pages that will actually be processed.
massviews-oversized-set-unknown: An error message saying $1 (a data source) contains too many pages to process. Same as the 'massviews-oversized-set' except here we don't know how many there are total. $2 is the number of pages that will actually be processed.
massviews-pagepile-description: Description of the 'pagepile' source in the Massviews tool. This is shown below the input field, and also in the FAQ. $1 is a link to the PagePile tool, with the non-translatable name 'PagePile' as the link text.
massviews-quarry-description: Description of the 'quarry' source in the Massviews tool. This is shown below the input field, and also in the FAQ. $1 is a link to the Quarry tool with the non-translatable name 'Quarry' as the link text.
massviews-redirect: Notice saying the user was redirected from the Pageviews app because they requested too many pages. $1 is the translation for 'title' (Pageviews app name), $2 is the number pages Pageviews can handle, and $3 is a link to the PagePile that was created.
massviews-search-description: Description of the 'search' source in the Massviews tool. $1 is a link to the help page for CirrusSearch, which provides documentation on advanced search features.
massviews-subpages-description: Description of the 'subpages' source in the Massviews tool. This is shown below the input field, and also in the FAQ. $1 is a link to a page describing what subpages are, with the message 'subpages' as the link text.
massviews-title: Title of the Massviews application, which allows you to import a large list of pages and get the pageviews counts. This title is shown as a header at the top of the page.
massviews-transclusions-description: Description of the 'transclusions' source in the Massviews tool. This is shown below the input field, and also in the FAQ. $1 is the URL to a page describing what transclusions are.
massviews-wikilinks-description: Description of the 'wikilinks' source in the Massviews tool. This is shown below the input field, and also in the FAQ. $1 is the URL to a page describing what wikilinks are.
median:
Label for the mathematical median of the dataset.
{{Identical|Median}}
mediaviews: Abbreviated name of the Mediaviews application. This is used in the inter-app links in the header
mediaviews-description: Brief description of the Mediaviews tool. Shown directly under the header.
mediaviews-title: The title of the Mediaviews tool. This is shown as a header at the top of the page.
metric:
Header for the dropdown to choose which metric to view statistics for in the Siteviews app, such as 'Pageviews' or 'Unique devices'.
{{Identical|Metric}}
mo: Abbreviation for Monday, a day of the week.
mobile:
Label for option to view statistics for the mobile site in the Siteviews application
{{Identical|Mobile}}
mobile-app: Label for option to view statistics for the mobile application only
mobile-web: Label for option to view statistics for the mobile website only
monthly:
Label for option to view statistics for on a monthly basis in the Topviews app. Appears next to {{msg-wm|Pageviews-daily}} and {{msg-wm|Pageviews-yearly}}.
{{Identical|Monthly}}
monthly-average: Label for the value showing the monthly average of pageviews. This goes under a 'Pageviews' heading, so you do not need to use the word 'Pageviews'.
more:
Label for dropdown in navigation that lists more links.
{{Identical|More}}
most-viewed-pages: Link to view the most viewed pages of a project
most-viewed-rank: Text saying that a page ranked as one of the top most-viewed pages for a month. $1 is the number of the ranking, $2 is a link to the Topviews app with the message for "most-viewed-pages" as the link text, and $3 is the month name and year.
namespace:
Label for the dropdown to pick a namespace in the Userviews tool.
{{Identical|Namespace}}
new-article-warning: Warning that data of new pages may not be available yet. $1 is a link to the FAQ with the message 'learn-more' as the text.
no-autocompletion: Label for option to disable autocompletion when searching
none:
The word 'none', used for general purpose.
{{Identical|None}}
note:
The word that goes before a general notice, such as a temporarily limited feature.
{{Identical|Note}}
notice-year-stats: Message advertizing that the most-viewed pages of the past year are now available. $1 is the year.
num-bytes:
Text indicating a number of bytes. $1 is the formatted number, $2 is the same number but unformatted so that it can be used with PLURAL.
{{Identical|Byte}}
num-days-span: Indicates the number of days across which a user was active in creating articles. Shown above the 'date created' column in the Userviews tool. $1 is the number of days as a formatted number, $2 is the same number but unformatted so that it can be used with PLURAL.
num-files:
Indicates the number of files that were queried for in the Mediaviews app. $1 is the formatted number, $2 is the same number but unformatted so that it can be used with PLURAL.
{{Identical|File}}
num-files-info: Text indicating the number of files the user is allowed to enter in the Mediaviews application. $1 is the number. Similar to the 'num-pages-info' message.
num-languages:
Indicates the number of languages a Langviews query returned. $1 is the formatted number, $2 is the same number but unformatted so that it can be used with PLURAL.
{{Identical|Language}}
num-pagecounts:
Text indicating a number of pagecounts. Similar to the 'num-pageviews' message. $1 is the formatted number, $2 is the same number but unformatted so that it can be used with PLURAL.
{{Identical|Pagecount}}
num-pages:
Text simply indicating a number of pages. This is used as a label in the Massviews app, indicating how many pages are in the collection. $1 is the formatted number, $2 is the same number but unformatted so that it can be used with PLURAL.
{{Identical|Page}}
num-pages-info: Text indicating the number of pages the user is allowed to enter. $1 is the number.
num-pageviews:
Text indicating a number of pageviews. Similar to the 'num-pages' message. $1 is the formatted number, $2 is the same number but unformatted so that it can be used with PLURAL.
{{Identical|Pageview}}
num-projects:
Text indicating the number of projects that are being shown in the Siteviews app. $1 is the formatted number, $2 is the same number but unformatted so that it can be used with PLURAL.
{{Identical|Project}}
num-projects-info: Text indicating the number of projects the user is allowed to enter in the Siteviews application. $1 is the number. Similar to the 'num-pages-info' message.
num-protections:
$1 is the formatted number, $2 is the same number but unformatted so that it can be used with PLURAL.
{{Identical|Protection}}
num-redirects:
Text indicating a number of redirects. Similar to the 'num-pages' message. $1 is the formatted number, $2 is the same number but unformatted so that it can be used with PLURAL.
{{Identical|Redirect}}
num-requests:
Text indicating a number of requests to a file. $1 is the formatted number, $2 is the number but unformatted so that it can be used with PLURAL.
{{Identical|Request}}
num-seconds:
Text indicating a number of seconds. $1 is the formatted number, $2 is the same number but unformatted so that it can be used with PLURAL.
{{Identical|Redirect}}
num-sections:
Indicates the number of redirects to a section there were in the Redirectviews results. $1 is the formatted number, $2 is the same number but unformatted so that it can be used with PLURAL.
{{Identical|Second}}
num-subpages:
Text indicating a number of subpages. This is used as a label in the Massviews app, indicating how many subpages a page has. $1 is the formatted number, $2 is the same number but unformatted so that it can be used with PLURAL.
{{Identical|Subpage}}
num-transclusions:
Text indicating a number of transclusions. This is used as a label in the Massviews app, indicating how many transclusions a template has. $1 is the formatted number, $2 is the same number but unformatted so that it can be used with PLURAL.
{{Identical|Transclusion}}
num-unique-devices: Text indicating a number of unique devices. This is used as a label in the Siteviews app, indicating how many unique devices accessed a project. $1 is the formatted number, $2 is the same number but unformatted so that it can be used with PLURAL.
num-wikilinks:
Text indicating a number of wikilinks. This is used as a label in the Massviews app, indicating how many wikilinks are on a page. $1 is the formatted number, $2 is the same number but unformatted so that it can be used with PLURAL.
{{Identical|Wikilink}}
only-redirects: Option to return only redirects in the Userviews tool.
options:
Label for the area of the page to set options for the query.
{{Identical|Options}}
original-rank:
Label for the column listing the original rank a false positive page had.
{{Identical|Original rank}}
other:
The word 'other', used for general purpose.
{{Identical|Other}}
page:
Header for the singular page input for Langviews application
{{Identical|Page}}
page-title:
Heading for the column of page titles in the Langviews application
{{Identical|Page title}}
pagecounts:
The word 'pagecounts'. Used as the label to show the number of pagecounts a page received. This is a different metric than 'pageviews'.
{{Identical|Pagecounts}}
pagecounts-legacy: Label in the option to show legacy pagecounts data, as opposed to pageviews or unique devices.
pages:
Header for the part of the interface that lets the user enter which pages they want to view statistics for
{{Identical|Page}}
pageviews:
The word 'pageviews'. Used as the link for the Pageviews application in the header, and as the label of the column for the view counts in Langviews
{{Identical|Pageview}}
pageviews-description: Brief description of the Pageviews tool. Shown directly under the header.
param-error-1: Error message for when older data is requested that is not available.
param-error-2: Error message for when the given start date is after the end date.
param-error-3: General error message for when an invalid parameter is passed in. $1 is the name of the parameter.
param-error-4: Error message for when the requested date is outside the allowed range.
param-error-see-docs: $1 is a link to the tool's URL documentation, with the message 'documentation' as the text.
percent-mobile:
Label for the column showing the percentage of mobile pageviews a page had.
{{Identical|Mobile}}
permalink:
A permanent link to the tool with the current data. By default the tool shows the latest-N days, this will link to the exact date range.
{{Identical|Permalink}}
permalink-copied: Message shown when a permanent link to the tool has been copied to the user's clipboard.
platform:
Header for the part of the interface that lets the user choose which platform to view statistics for. For example, 'Desktop', 'Mobile app', etc.
{{Identical|Platform}}
png:
{{Optional}}
Link for PNG image file. See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Portable_Network_Graphics for information on what a PNG image is.
polar-area: Label for polar area chart option (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pie_chart#Polar_area_diagram)
processing-page: Text shown below the progress bar in some apps to indicate which page is being process out of how many total pages. $1 is the current page being processed, and $2 is the total number of pages that will be processed.
project:
Header for the part of the interface that lets the user select which project they want to view statistics for.
{{Identical|Project}}
projects:
Header for the part of the interface that lets the user select which projects they want to view statistics for in the Siteviews application.
{{Identical|Project}}
projects-placeholder: Placeholder text for the form input where the user enters the projects they want to view statistics for in the Siteviews application
proofread-page: The name for the 'proofread' quality assessment of a page. The name may differ project to project, see Wikidata for possible translations: https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q20748092
protection:
Label for the value showing the protection level of the page.
{{Identical|Protection}}
query-for: Heading above the options to query for individual projects or all projects in the Siteviews app.
rank:
Heading for the column showing the page rank in the Topviews application.
{{Identical|Rank}}
recommended-article: The name for the 'recommended' quality assessment of a page. The name may differ project to project, see Wikidata for possible translations: https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q17559452
redirects:
Link to show all redirects for an article.
{{Identical|Redirect}}
redirects-and-non-redirects: Option to return redirects and non-redirects in the Userviews tool.
redirectviews: Abbreviated name of the Redirect Views application. For this particular app, the name should probably be the same as the 'redirectviews-title' message.
redirectviews-description: Brief description of the Redirectviews tool. Shown directly under the header.
redirectviews-title: The title of the Redirectviews tool. This is shown as a header at the top of the page. (See https://pageviews.toolforge.org/redirectviews/)
referer: Label for dropdown to chose the [[Wikipedia:HTTP referer|referer]] type in the Mediaviews app.
referer-all-referers: Label for option to view statistics for all [[Wikipedia:HTTP referer|referers]] in the Mediaviews tool.
referer-external:
Label for option to view statistics for external [[Wikipedia:HTTP referer|referers]].
{{Identical|External}}
referer-internal: Label for option to view statistics for internal [[Wikipedia:HTTP referer|referers]].
referer-search-engine: Label for option to view statistics for search engine [[Wikipedia:HTTP referer|referers]].
remember-chart-option: Label for option to remember chart preference across sessions.
report-false-positive: Link to report pages as false positives in the Topviews app.
report-false-positive-submitted: Message shown when a user has submitted a false positive report. $1 is the 'topviews' message (name of the app).
report-false-positive-text: Text above the 'Report false positive' form. $1 is a link to the FAQ with the message 'learn-more' as the link text.
report-issue: Link to report an issue or bug with the tool
requests:
Label for number of requests that were made to a file. This is the unit of measurement used in the Mediaviews app.
{{Identical|Request}}
revisions:
Heading for the list of data about revisions of a page.
{{Identical|Revision}}
sa: Abbreviation for Saturday, a day of the week.
search:
Label for the search field in the Topviews app.
{{Identical|Search}}
section:
Heading for the column of section titles in the Redirectviews application, as in the section of an article.
{{Identical|Section}}
select2-loading: Notice telling the user that more results are loading
select2-max-chars: Instructions for the user to delete a certain number of characters. $1 is a number.
select2-max-items: Notice telling the user that they can't select any more items. $1 is a number.
select2-min-chars: Instructions for the user to type at least a certain number of characters. $1 is a number.
select2-no-results: Notice telling the user that no results were found
settings:
Link that opens an interface for the user to change their settings, for example, the date formatting
{{Identical|Settings}}
settings-notice: Notice shown at top of interface for setting user options
show-mobile-percentages: Label for a checkbox to show the percentage of mobile pageviews each page has in Topviews.
show-more: Link to reveal more of the Topviews data
show-values: Label for the option to show values over the points of the chart.
siteviews: Abbreviated name of the Siteviews application. This is used in the inter-app links in the header
siteviews-description: Brief description of the Siteviews tool. Shown directly under the header.
siteviews-title: The title of the Siteviews tool. This is shown as a header at the top of the page.
size:
Label for the value showing the size of the page.
{{Identical|Size}}
source:
Label for the 'source' input field in the Massviews tool.
{{Identical|Source}}
source-project: The label for the source project to query from on the Langviews application
spider:
Label for option to view statistics for [[wikipedia:Web crawler|spider]] (web crawler) agents only (not users or automated programs)
{{Identical|Spider}}
statistics:
Link to show a project's statistics page
{{Identical|Statistics}}
su: Abbreviation for Sunday, a day of the week.
subcategories:
Label for number of categories within a category.
{{Identical|Subcategory}}
submit:
The text for the button to submit the form in the Langviews application.
{{Identical|Submit}}
subpages:
Label for the 'Subpages' input field on the Massviews tool. See the wikidata item for 'Project:Subpages' for possible translations: https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q4592255
{{Identical|Subpage}}
target:
In the Redirect Views app, a page of all redirects to a given page are shown. This 'Target' text is shown next to the given page, which is the target of all the other redirects. This text should be lowercased, if possible.
{{Identical|Target}}
th: Abbreviation for Thursday, a day of the week.
this-month:
Link to set the date range to the current month
{{Identical|This month}}
this-week: Link to set the date range to the current week
this-year:
Link to set the date range to the current year
{{Identical|This year}}
title: The title of the tool. This is shown as a header at the top of the page.
tool-labs: The name of the hosting service. See https://wikitech.wikimedia.org/wiki/Portal:Tool_Labs for more information.
topviews: Abbreviated name of the Topviews application. This is used in the inter-app links in the header
topviews-description: Brief description of the Topviews tool. Shown directly under the header.
topviews-false-positive: Text that shows above the list of pages on Topviews that explains there might be false positives. This links to the relevant FAQ section. Please do not alter the link.
topviews-remove-page: Text shown when hovering over the X link that removes a page from the Topviews rankings.
topviews-title: The title of the Topviews tool. This is shown as a header at the top of the page. (See https://pageviews.toolforge.org/topviews/)
total-pageviews: Label for chart options that show total pageviews for each article
totals:
Label for the total number of pageviews
{{Identical|Total}}
transclusions:
Label for the 'Transclusions' input field on the Massviews tool. See the wikidata item for 'transclusion' for possible translations: https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q1207412
{{Identical|Transclusion}}
translation-credits: Footer message crediting translation tools translatewiki.net ($1) and Intuition ($2)
tu: Abbreviation for Tuesday, a day of the week.
unique-devices: Label for option to view statistics for unique devices only (as opposed to all page views)
unique-titles: Indicates the number of unique titles a Langviews query returned. $1 is the actual number.
unknown:
The word 'unknown', used for general purpose.
{{Identical|Unknown}}
unsupported-browser-error: Message saying the user's browser is not supported. $1 is the browser version.
url-structure: Link to documentation about the URL structure used by the tool
url-structure-agent: This explains the 'agent' parameter, which can have one of the values 'user' ($1), 'spider' ($2), 'automated' ($3) or 'all-agents' ($4). Each of these will be in a <code> tag.
url-structure-autolog: Documentation for the 'autolog' parameter. $1 is the only valid value for this parameter, and $2 is the i18n message 'logarithmic-scale'.
url-structure-current: Documentation for the 'current' parameter, which evaluates to the most recent day.
url-structure-end-date: Documentation for the 'end' parameter, stating it defaults to the previous day. $1 is the date format used.
url-structure-end-date-latest: Documentation for using the latest available day as the 'end' parameter.
url-structure-end-month: Documentation for the 'end' parameter when targeting a specific month instead of a day. $1 is the format used.
url-structure-example:
Example of how to link to Pageviews Analysis on a wiki.
$1 is the example link,
$2 is the 'example' project name,
$3 is the message for 'project' that is a link to the sitematrix,
$4 is {{FULLPAGENAMEE}}
url-structure-example-siteviews: Example of how to link to Siteviews Analysis on a wiki. $1 is the example link. This message is the same as the first sentence of 'url-structure-example'
url-structure-excludes: Documentation for the 'excludes' parameter. These pages will be hidden from view, such as false-positives or irrelevant pages.
url-structure-files: Documentation for the 'files' parameter. $1 is an example value.
url-structure-massviews-example:
Example of how to link to Massviews Analysis. $1 is the example for Page Piles, $2 for categories, and $3 for linking on a category wiki page. Shown on "https://pageviews.toolforge.org/massviews/url_structure/".

Every parameter is shown as a separate paragraph in monospaced font (in a <pre> tag), so don't use any HTML or wiki markup in the translation.
url-structure-massviews-project: Similar to the 'url-structure-project' message except indicates this parameter only applies to Quarry results. $1 is the message for 'project' that is a link to the sitematrix (list of valid projects).
url-structure-massviews-target: Explains what the 'target' parameter is, and that if a question mark is in the URL than the URL must be encoded. '''FIXME:''' This message still does not explicit how to encode the question mark: with URL-encoding as %3F, with a double encoding as %%3F, with HTML/XML character entity such as ?, or something else?
url-structure-massviews-target-example: Example of valid and invalid target values. $1 is an invalid example, $2 is the valid equivalent. $3 is the shortened wiki URL which is also valid. Please closely follow the English translation for this message. All parameters are HTML elements that show up on their own line.
url-structure-mute-validations: Documentation for the 'mutevalidations' parameter. $1 is the only value value that can be passed in.
url-structure-onwiki-link: Text explaining to use {{FULLPAGENAMEE}} ($1) as the 'project' on wiki.
url-structure-parameters:
Heading for the list of parameters
{{Identical|Parameter}}
url-structure-parameters-order: Text explaining that parameters can be used in any order
url-structure-project: Documentation for the 'project' parameter. $1 is the default (en.wikipedia.org), $2 is the link to the site matrix
url-structure-project-multilang: Text exlaining the provided source project must be multilingual. $1 and $2 are the example Wikipedia and Wikivoyage
url-structure-projects:
Documentation for the 'projects' parameter of the Siteviews application.
* $1 is the translated word "projects", which links to the site matrix.
* $2 is the example of multiple projects you could include.
url-structure-redirects: Documentation for the 'redirects' parameter. $1 and $2 are valid values.
url-structure-siteviews-agent: Message saying the 'agent' options only apply when the 'source' is set to 'pageviews'. $1 is the non-translatable parameter parameter name 'source', and $2 is the non-translatable value 'pageviews'.
url-structure-siteviews-platform: Message saying the following parameters only apply when the 'source' parameter is set to $2. $1 is the non-translatable parameter name 'source'
url-structure-siteviews-platform-no-page: Message saying the following parameters only apply when the 'source' parameter is set to $2 or $3. $1 is the non-translatable parameter name 'source'
url-structure-sort: Documentation for the 'sort' parameter. This is used in several places and is followed a list of the possible values.
url-structure-sort-direction: Documentation for the 'direction' parameter. $1 is the value for descending, $2 is the value for ascending
url-structure-source: Documentation for the 'source' parameter. $1 and $2 are valid values
url-structure-special-range: Documentation on the 'range' parameter. $1 is the parameter 'start', $2 is the parameter 'end'. This message is followed by a list.
url-structure-special-range-latest: States that the value 'latest' will show the last 20 days of data
url-structure-special-range-latest-n: Explains that you can use 'latest-N' and replace N with the number of days
url-structure-start-date: Documentation for the 'start' parameter. $1 is the date format used.
url-structure-start-date-earliest: Documentation for using the earliest available day as the 'start' parameter.
url-structure-start-month: Documentation for the 'start' parameter when targeting a specific month instead of a day. $1 is the format used ('YYYY-MM' instead of 'YYYY-MM-DD').
url-structure-subjectpage: Documentation for the 'subjectpage' parameter. $1 is a link to the FAQ entry for this option (the text of the link is the i18n message 'category-subject-toggle'). $2 is the value to enable the option, $3 is the value to disable it.
url-structure-topviews-date-day: Documentation for providing a specific day for the 'date' parameter. $1 is the format the date should be in.
url-structure-topviews-date-month: Documentation for providing a specific month for the 'date' parameter. $1 is the format the date should be in.
url-structure-topviews-example:
Example of how to link to Topviews Analysis on a wiki.
$1 is the example project link,
$2 is the translatable 'example' project name,
$3 is the translatable word for 'project', linked to the site matrix,
and $4 is the 'excludes' parameter name.
url-structure-topviews-mainspace: Documentation for the 'mainspace' parameter, which controls if mainspace pages are shown in Topviews.
url-structure-topviews-mobileviews: Documentation on of the 'mobileviews' parameter. $1 is the 'show-mobile-percentages' message, which is the label for the option in the interface. $2 is the 'platform' parameter, and $3 is the value 'all-access'.
url-structure-userviews-example: Example of how to link to the Userviews tool from a user's userpage. $1 is the code.
url-structure-userviews-namespace: Documentation for the 'namespace' parameter. $1 and $2 are untranslatable values.
url-structure-userviews-onwiki-link: Text explaining what to use when linking from a userpage on the wiki. $1 is the code.
url-structure-userviews-redirects: $1 to exclude redirects (default), $2 to only include redirects, or $3 to include redirects and non-redirects.
url-structure-view: Documentation for the 'view' parameter. $1 is the value to show the data as a list, or $2 to show the data as a chart
user:
Label for option to view statistics for user agents only (not spiders or automated programs)
{{Identical|User}}
userviews: Abbreviated name of the Userviews application. This is used in the inter-app links in the header
userviews-description: Brief description of the Userviews tool. Shown directly under the header.
userviews-edit-count-warning: Warning shown in the Userviews app when the requested user has a high edit count. $1 is a link to the user page and $2 is the number of edits.
userviews-oversized-set: An error message saying the user ($1) has created more pages than the tool can handle. $1 is a link to the user's userpage, $2 is the limit on the number of pages, and $3 is the number of pages that will be processed.
userviews-title: The title of the Userviews tool. This is shown as a header at the top of the page.
validated-page: The name for the 'validated' quality assessment of a page. The name may differ project to project, see Wikidata for possible translations: https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q20748093
view-source:
Link to the source code for the tool
{{Identical|View source}}
views:
Label for the value showing the number of views that viewed to the pages during the timeframe.
{{Identical|View}}
watchers:
Label for the value showing the number of watchers (i.e. users who added the page to watchlist) a page has. Should use a word that is related to {{msg-mw|watchlist}}.
{{Identical|Watcher}}
we: Abbreviation for Wednesday, a day of the week.
wikilinks:
Label for the 'Wikilinks' input field on the Massviews tool. Wikilinks are links on a page that link to other pages.
{{Identical|Wikilink}}
yearly:
Label for option to view statistics for on a yearly basis in the Topviews app. Appears next to {{msg-wm|Pageviews-daily}} and {{msg-wm|Pageviews-monthly}}.
{{Identical|Yearly}}
